verses.text: Praise the LORD, all you nations; extol him, all you peoples.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 117
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 117 This is the shortest chapter in the Bible, but the song’s exuberant praise reaches to all the nations. Paul uses the psalm to show that the nations share in the promises to the patriarchs (Rom. 15:7–11).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 117:1
rsbNotes.text: 117:1 all nations. The call to praise goes beyond Israel to all nations.

verses.text: For great is his love toward us, and the faithfulness of the LORD endures forever. Praise the LORD.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 117:2
rsbNotes.text: 117:2 his steadfast love. Specifically, the love connected with His covenant. This verse, though using different vocabulary, may be seen as a meditation on the truth expressed in Ex. 34:6. It celebrates God’s covenant relationship with His people.
